trans-unit.source: Name of the environment variable to set.

seg-source.mrk: Name of the environment variable to set.

target.mrk: Name of the environment variable to set.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Value to set the environment variable to. If a value is not used the environment variable will be deleted.

seg-source.mrk: Value to set the environment variable to.
If a value is not used the environment variable will be deleted.

target.mrk: Value to set the environment variable to.
If a value is not used the environment variable will be deleted.

trans-unit.source: A environment variable set in this way will only be accessible to programs that AutoIt spawns (Run(), RunWait()). Once AutoIt closes, the variables will cease to exist.

seg-source.mrk: A environment variable set in this way will only be accessible to programs that AutoIt spawns (Run(), RunWait()).
Once AutoIt closes, the variables will cease to exist.

target.mrk: A environment variable set in this way will only be accessible to programs that AutoIt spawns (Run(), RunWait()).
Once AutoIt closes, the variables will cease to exist.

trans-unit.source: Create an environment variable called %MYVAR% and assign it a value. When you assign or retrieve an environment variable you do so minus the percentage signs (%).

seg-source.mrk: Create an environment variable called %MYVAR% and assign it a value.
When you assign or retrieve an environment variable you do so minus the percentage signs (%).

target.mrk: Create an environment variable called %MYVAR% and assign it a value.
When you assign or retrieve an environment variable you do so minus the percentage signs (%).

trans-unit.source: Retrieve the environment variable that was just assigned a value previously.

seg-source.mrk: Retrieve the environment variable that was just assigned a value previously.

target.mrk: Retrieve the environment variable that was just assigned a value previously.

trans-unit.source: Display the value of the environment variable $MYVAR%.

seg-source.mrk: Display the value of the environment variable $MYVAR%.

target.mrk: Display the value of the environment variable $MYVAR%.

trans-unit.source: The environment variable %MYVAR% has the value of:
